result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Laverne Cage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
All court costs, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by Department of Corrections in an amout or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  Credit for one (1) day.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs.

Follow all rules of supervision. 
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Bail refund packet.  vp
Count one and three.
Count two.
17A 005869/reapplied
17A 005831/reversed to fix

Defendant Thomas Laverne Cage in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Vickie C.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 1 day credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 1 day credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count. 

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS with 1 day credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

 Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.
Defense Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas Laverne Cage in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 01/17/2017 is vacated.  As to Counts 1-3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.
